intro: Heptapleurum scandens, commonly known as the climbing heptapleurum, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically followed by spherical berries. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and used in traditional medicine in some regions.
